document_title: Diarrhea: Causes, symptoms, treatment and prevention
subsection_name: tieu-chay.json_5_Subjects at high risk of diarrhea
subsection_content:
Diarrhea occurs commonly every year, is easily transmitted and breaks out into epidemics. Accordingly, the Ministry of Health recommends that people in the high-risk group include:
People who regularly eat, drink, and live close to diarrhea patients but do not apply preventive measures; People living in the area use unsanitary latrines, with feces going straight into sewers, ponds, lakes, rivers, streams, ditches, etc.; Using polluted and unsanitary water sources; Have unhygienic eating habits, often eating raw vegetables and undercooked seafood; Use fresh and untreated manure in farming; People living in flooded or post-flooded areas.
